title: Board Track Racer 2016 The Vincent Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up just about two-thirds of this wine, with the balance Merlot and Malbec. Blue fruit, anise, herb and spice aromas are at the fore. The palate boasts soft fruit flavors that linger on the finish.

title: Bründlmayer 2017 L&T Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Ripe yellow pear makes for an appetizing nose. The palate has the same friendly fruit, with a little more green-pear freshness. It is light, dry and easy.

title: Buccia Nera 2015 Sassocupo  (Chianti Superiore)
description: Made from 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this suggests dark-skinned fruit, tilled soil and tobacco on the nose. The savory palate offers dried black cherry, clove and white pepper notes alongside firm tannins. Drink 2019–2023.

title: Burchino 2016 L'Antico  (Chianti Superiore)
description: This opens with dark berry, leather and forest floor aromas. The medium-bodied palate delivers dried black cherry, star anise and licorice flavors alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Buttonwood Grove 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: This wine is clean and focused on the nose in notes of citrus rind, crushed stone and grassy, blossomy floral tones. The light-bodied, dry palate offers pithy lemon-lime flavors, with a wealth of white flowers and minerals that linger on the finish.

title: Cantagallo 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Montalbano)
description: This wine's cedar, vanilla and dark-skinned fruit aromas emerge in the glass. The firm palate offers dark berry, mocha and star anise flavors alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Casa Larga 2017 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)
description: Ballet-slipper pink, this rosé boasts aromas of cherry blossom, watermelon and crushed stone on the nose. The palate shows good texture and grip, with flavors of cranberry skins and strawberry met with a citric backdrop and a delicate peach-fuzz finish.

title: Caves de Rauzan 2017 Augey  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This wine is ripe, soft with rich apple and pear fruits. With balanced acidity and a youthful zesty character, it is full, rounded and will pair well with food. The aftertaste adds a perfumed character. Drink this wine now.

title: Cesani 2016 Pancole  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This wine's yellow spring flower, citrus and ripe orchard fruit aromas carry over to the tangy palate, along with a juicy hint of tangerine. A pleasantly bitter almond note signals the close.

title: Château Barbebelle 2017 Cuvée Madeleine Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This rich wine, the classic blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault, is ripe and smoothly fruity, with a bright touch of acidity that gives the wine its great lift. It is ready to drink.

title: Château de Berne 2017 Inspiration Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This full, rich wine emphasizes ripe berry fruits rather than crispness. That makes for a wine that is warm, intensely fruity, soft on the palate and ready to drink now.

title: Château des Antonins 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Smooth and ripe, this rounded wine has a rich character as well as crisper acidity. It is softly textured, full of great fruit and ready to drink.

title: Château d'Ollières 2017 Prestige White (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: This crisp, light wine is a blend of 90% of the local Rolle and 10% Ugni Blanc. It has attractive acidity, plus plenty of apple and citrus fruits with a zesty lemon-peel edge. This bright wine is ready to drink now.

title: Château Grand Jean 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Tangy and mineral driven, this bright, crisp and fruity wine holds 70% Sémillon. Its texture is dominant at this stage, emphasizing a herbal character and intense acidity needs to soften. Wait for this Dulon family wine until the end of 2018.

title: Chateau Malbat 2017 L'Authentique  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This refreshing, bright wine from the Rochet family is full of acidity and delicious apple and spice flavors. Its balance is just right, hinting at an herbal edge while preserving the pure direct of fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Château Merlet 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Juicy, crisp and fruity, this is an immediately refreshing wine. It has an herbal edge although the wine is really more about apple and pear flavors. Drink now.

title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2017 Summer Dreams Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The engraving of Saint-Tropez on the bottle sets the summer scene behind this wine. Its fruitiness and light acidity evoke warm days while the rich berry flavors give a rounded texture. This wine is ready to drink.

title: Chatham 2016 Church Creek Steel Chardonnay (Virginia's Eastern Shore)
description: This unoaked Chardonnay is fresh in with aromas of lemon, grapefruit, lees and wet stone. The palate mirrors the nose, with vibrant acidity that extends the long, cheeky finish.

title: Còlpetrone 2011  Montefalco Sagrantino
description: This wine's tilled earth, leather and cassis aromas emerge in the glass. The ripe, rather evolved palate shows mature black plum, roasted coffee and licorice flavors alongside close-grained tannins.

title: Delas Frères 2015 Domaine des Genêts Red (Vacqueyras)
description: Understated black cherry and blackberry flavors are marked by pert, sour cherry-like acidity in this Grenache-based blend. It's a bold, full-bodied wine kept elegant by delicate earth and dried herb tones. Firm, persistent tannins frame its moderately long finish.

title: Der Pollerhof 2017 vom Löss White (Niederösterreich)
description: A touch of honeysuckle, a hint of crushed citrus foliage and grass are hinted at. They also shimmer on the light palate where vivid freshness leads onto a fragrant dry finish.

title: Domaine des Diables 2017 MiP Made in Provence Collection Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Perfumed, flavored with thyme as well as crisp red fruits, this fragrant wine also has a zing of tight acidity. It has plenty of fruitiness, refreshing and tangy at the same time. Drink now.

title: Domaine la Grand'Vigne 2017 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: From a 24-acre vineyard, this wine is a blend of Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre and Cinsault. The perfumed wine is rich with strawberries and ripe with caramel, spice and soft acidity. Drink now.

title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Blaufränkisch (Finger Lakes)
description: Sour cherry, bramble berry and a bit of pepper carry the nose of this wine. The medium-bodied palate is soft in feel, with juicy red cherry and strawberry flavors that meld with a floral lilt. This is enjoyable for its immediate easydrinking appeal.

title: Dürnberg 2017 L&T Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Lemon and green pear make a very slight appearance on the almost neutral nose. On the light palate, their image is clearer and refreshing with a hint of Grüner's herbal tang before ending in a zesty finish.

title: Falchini 2016 Vigna a Solatio  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: Aromas reminiscent of mature yellow stone fruit and yellow spring flowers lead the way in this. The tangy palate evokes apricot, citrus and yellow apple. A bitter almond hint signals the close.

title: Famille Laplace 2014 Maydie Vintage Tannat (Vin de Liqueur)
description: When Tannat, Madiran's bold red grape, is fortified with brandy, its tannins and spiritous edge create a contrast. The result: rich, jammy red fruit flavors and potent tannins. It will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Fattoria Fibbiano 2015 Casalini  (Chianti Superiore)
description: This blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Ciliegiolo offers delicate black-skinned fruit and earthy underbrush aromas. The straightforward, enjoyable palate offers crushed plum, green tea and white pepper flavors alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Ferraton Pere et Fils 2017 Samorëns Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Crushed mineral and delicate rosemary and sage notes are at the forefront of this elegant, dry rosé. Its crisp red cherry and dried strawberry flavors are understated and lean, with vibrant, balanced acidity. The finish is moderately long, with lingering mineral freshness.

title: Gómez de Segura 2013 Finca Ratón Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cottony plum and berry aromas are a touch soapy. This is plodding and on the heavy side. Saturated stewy berry and spice flavors are chocolaty and oaky on the finish, as well as herbal. This offers a lot, but it's coarse, jumpy and suffers a bit under its own weight.
